text:
An 11-year-old girl was gang-raped and strangled to death allegedly by three youths in the Qutubshetra police station area here, the police said on Sunday.

According to Superintendent of Police R.P.S. Yadav, the girl had gone missing on January 5. The body was recovered on January 7 after the police intensified searches in the area.

All the three accused were arrested on Sunday.

The minor and her mother were visiting a relative. The mother sent her to the neighbour’s house for some work and she had been missing since then, the SP said. The mother filed a complaint and the police found the body on the Gangoh Road under the Qutubshetra police station limits, Mr. Yadav said. The post-mortem report said she was first gang-raped and later strangulated.

A police team with the help of sniffer dogs arrested the three accused, Dharamveer, Inderjeet and Shiv Kumar, the SP said.

The team will be rewarded for achieving a breakthrough in the case. Further investigation is on. — PTI
title: Girl gang-raped, strangled to death in U.P.
